header.title: ONAOS - A Guide to the Sinister Tarot
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Sinister Magic, Tarot, Chaos Magic, Aeonics

central_thesis: The ONAOS text presents the Sinister Tarot as a potent tool within the Order of Nine Angles' (ONA) septenary tradition for initiating individuals into deeper consciousness and facilitating contact with acausal energies and Dark Gods. It posits that traditional Qabalistic Tarot is a distorted, ineffective system, advocating for the ONA Tarot's "genuine symbolism" which integrates specific alchemical processes, planetary correspondences, and unique archetypes to guide practitioners through stages of internal transformation and external manifestation, ultimately leading to Aeonic understanding and the mastery of acausal forces.

structure_content.summary: A foundational diagram representing the seven spheres and their pathways, serving as a map of consciousness and intersection points of causal and acausal realities.

Explains the core philosophical premise of magick as the drawing and utilization of acausal energies from a parallel universe to effect change in the causal realm and consciousness. Humans are 'gates' to this acausal universe.

Details the practical steps for initial magickal workings involving the seven spheres, emphasizing meditation, chanting, visualization of Tarot archetypes (Unconscious, Ego, Self), and the importance of specific ritual settings and duration.

Presents a table linking alchemical stages (Calcination, Seperation, Coagulation, Putrefaction, Sublimation, Fermentation, Exaltation) with specific words, sigils, seasons, and forms, contextualized against distorted Golden Dawn Tarot traditions.

Outlines the ONA Sinister Tarot's unique structure, advocating for initiates to create their own decks, and provides guidelines for card readings (Celtic and Septenary spreads), emphasizing intuitive interpretation and the rejection of reversed card meanings.
Tables detailing specific color attributions (Unconscious, Ego, Self) for each planetary sphere, crucial for visualization and understanding energetic aspects in pathworking.
A table correlating planets, ATU (Tarot card numbers), archetypes, and specific Words of Power/Dark Gods, each with a unique sigil, forming a core pantheon for invocation and pathworking.
Provides specific incense compositions (Unconscious, Ego, Self aspects) corresponding to planetary attributions, designed for Sinister Tarot meditations and Dark Pathworking rituals.

structure_content.chapter_title: Sinister Tarot – Brief Study Notes from Fenrir Volume III. no. 3
structure_content.summary: Expands on the distinctness of the ONA Tarot's court cards (Magus, Mousa, Warrior, Maiden) and elemental attributions compared to Golden Dawn, further critiquing Qabalistic systems as ineffective and distorted.

Explains pathworking as a fundamental technique for magickal development, distinguishing between imagination-led and deeper states where card entities become alive, leading to genuine Initiation and direct invocation rituals with specific requirements and procedures.

structure_content.chapter_title: Tarot Images – The Three Levels of the Spheres
structure_content.summary: A table illustrating how specific Tarot card numbers represent the Unconscious, Ego, and Self levels for each of the seven spheres, aligning with the Mercury, Salt, and Sulphur alchemical principles.

structure_content.chapter_title: Notes on Esoteric Tradition – Part III Esoteric Manuscripts & Notes on Some Terms Used
structure_content.summary: Defines key ONA concepts such as Septenary, Gate/Star-Gate/Nexion (acausal-causal nexus), Archetypes (apprehensions of acausal energies), Psyche, Ego, and Self within the context of the seven-fold way and Adeptship, clarifying ONA's unique terminology.

structure_content.chapter_title: Notes from Chapter I - The Seven-Fold Way
structure_content.summary: Describes Physis as divided into seven stages of insight, corresponding to magickal degrees (Initiation to Immortal), each linked to a Tree of Wyrd sphere and its tripartite archetypal aspects (Unconscious, Ego, Self).

structure_content.chapter_title: NAOS DECK MSS - The Galactic Organic, Minoris, Aeonisy
structure_content.summary: Introduces Ryan Anschauung's addendum to the Naos Deck, detailing the 'Galactic Organic' system of living sigils and Aeonic imagery. It redefines terminology (Muse, Enclave) and provides specific narratives for each Court Card type (Magus, Mousa, Warrior, Maiden) through four alchemical/Aeonic stages (Formative, Plateau, Disintegrative, Flux).

key_concepts.definition: The act of drawing upon and utilizing acausal energies to effect change in either personal consciousness (internal magick) or the phenomenal causal world (external magick). It is rooted in the belief that the five senses provide an incomplete view of reality and that living entities possess certain energies from a parallel acausal universe.

The Acausal refers to a parallel universe, the source of energies manifesting in our phenomenal, observable Causal universe. The interaction between these two is central to ONA philosophy, with humans acting as 'gates' to the acausal.

A foundational septenary diagram comprising seven spheres and connecting pathways, serving as a map of consciousness (individual and where acausal/causal meet). It represents the initial, Initiated stage of apprehension of energies, preceding the abstract apprehension of the Star Game.

Esoterically defined as the individual's apprehension of acausal energies, manifesting consciously (e.g., in art, dreams) or unconsciously. In the ONA system, these are depicted by the Major Arcana and Court Cards and are meant to be stripped of their 'forms' through magickal training to access 'pure' acausal energy.

The core ONA framework, based on seven spheres and their tripartite aspects (Unconscious, Ego, Self). It directly opposes the Qabalistic ten-fold Tree of Life, which is deemed distorted and ineffective, and forms the basis for the Sinister Tarot and its rituals.

A magickal technique involving meditation on Sinister Tarot images. In its deeper form, it allows the entities or beings depicted in the cards to become 'alive' and manifest their acausal nature, leading to genuine Initiation and direct understanding of Dark Gods, bypassing written interpretations.

A nexus or point where the acausal and causal realms connect, allowing for energy flow between universes. Nexions can be latent within the psyche or physical locations, and can be 'opened' through natural cosmic change or intentional ritual work. Physical Star-Gates are said to exist near stars like Algol, Dabih, and Naos.

A system within the Naos Deck that treats sigils as 'living forms' whose geometrical shapes can be mentally transformed. It aims to interrupt static symbolic representations, allowing the psyche to access Aeonic energies and ultimately achieve 'Galactic / Alienic Transmission' or become a 'Star-Man' through rational hypothesis and practical stages.

Three hierarchical aspects of consciousness and archetypal apprehension within each sphere/stage, corresponding to alchemical principles (Mercury, Salt, Sulphur). Progress in a working involves moving from concentrating on the 'Unconscious' symbolism to the 'Ego' and finally the 'Self' aspects of a sphere.

New terminology introduced in Aeonisy. 'Muse' replaces 'Court Cards' to denote roles the Initiate may find themselves in, embodying archetypal energies. 'Enclave' replaces 'Suites' to refer to the numbered Minor Arcana cards (2-7), representing a process of internal/external alchemy derived from the Self-Immolation Rite.

practical_system.description: The ONAOS system outlines a multi-faceted approach to Sinister Magick, centered on the septenary Tree of Wyrd, the Sinister Tarot, and Dark Pathworking. Its core aim is to facilitate the Initiate's apprehension and utilization of 'acausal energies' for profound internal and external transformation, ultimately leading to Adeptship and Aeonic understanding. The system rejects traditional Qabalistic frameworks as distorted, proposing its own cosmology of causal and acausal realms and a pantheon of 'Dark Gods.' Practical work involves specific meditations, invocations, and visualizations tailored to individual spheres and archetypes, with an emphasis on intuitive engagement rather than rigid interpretation.
tools: Sinister Tarot Deck (preferably self-drawn/painted, or the Naos Deck version).
Black Robe (or nakedness) for ritual workings.
Altar, black cloth, crystal sphere/tetrahedron, candles (various colors, gold for readings).
Incenses specific to planetary attributions (e.g., Petriochor, Hazel, Sulphur, Yew, Sandalwood, Black Poplar, Oak, Musk, Alder, Civit, Beech, Henbane, Ash).
Sigils of Dark Gods for pre-ritual meditation.
The 'Tree of Wyrd' and 'Star Game' diagrams as conceptual and practical frameworks.
rituals: **Sphere Workings (Stage One – Initiation):** Hourly meditations performed after sunset, one sphere per day (Moon, Mercury, Venus, Sun, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn). Involves chanting the sphere's 'Word' (3x), concentrating on the 'Unconscious' Tarot card image (e.g., Moon 18), then moving to the 'Ego' card (Moon 15), and finally the 'Self' card (Moon 13), visualizing oneself as part of the depicted landscape.

**Dark Pathworking / Dark Pathways II:** A fundamental technique for magickal development. Involves preparing a ritual space (isolated, dark, incensed), dressing (black robe or naked), chanting the respective sphere chant (facing East, holding quartz crystal at chest height), vibrating the 'Sacred Word' (9x), performing a slow ritual dance (Deosil for lighter spheres, Widdershin for darker), accelerating the dance to collapse, vibrating/shouting the name strongly, visualizing the Tarot image without controlling visions, then reversing the dance and chanting 'I am the Power, I am the Glory, I am a God.' Prior to the ritual, meditation on the Dark God sigil for 15 minutes nightly for 7 days.

**Tarot Readings (Divination):** Involves shuffling Sinister Tarot cards while focusing on a question, cutting the deck three ways, and laying out the final cut according to the 'Celtic Spread' or 'Septenary Spread' (the latter relates cards to planetary/sphere aspects). Interpretations are intuitive, rejecting fixed 'book' meanings, and all cards are read upright. Incense (oakwood) and gold candles are recommended, ideally conducted at night.

relevant_quotes.text: Fundamental to magick is a belief that the phenomenal world of the five senses is incomplete. Magickians believe that we live in a world quite different from the one our five senses show to us they believe that every living thing possesses, because it is living, certain energies which we as individuals can sense and 'see' if we become receptive to them.
Each working is a journey into the archetypal world of hidden and higher consciousness, and you should undertake each journey in the spirit of adventure and as something real.
The ONA Tarot restores the genuine symbolism of the cards, and its representations are very powerful.

In undertaking a reading two important principles should be understood. First, the interpretation of each card is not rigid - the meanings suggested by each card should arise in your mind naturally, that is, they should be intuitive and spontaneous.

The Sinister Tarot possesses only 21 cards in the Major Arcana – there is no 'Universe' (Atu XXI). Also, there are only 11 cards in each suite – the four court cards, the 'Gate', and six others numbered two to seven.

When working with the Sinister Tarot the Initiate may notice that some workings are far more intense than others. Combined with this intensity is the feeling that the characters and scenery within the image have actually come to life themselves. That is, they suddenly have a life of their own, a life that is no longer restricted by the consciousness of the individual, but suddenly becomes distinctive and objective from that consciousness. It is within these deeper forms of Pathworking that genuine Initiation begins to take place...

Physis is divided into seven stages and these seven stages may be regarded as representing the the varying degrees of insight attained. In terms of traditional magick, the stages represent Initiation, Second Degree Initiation, External Adept, Internal Adept, Master/Mistress (or High Priest/Priestess), Magus and Immortal.

The Galactic Organic is an attempt at interrupting the boundaries set on the static image of symbols typically viewed either two or three dimensionally in order to allow the psyche to break them free of causal and spatial restraints and give them Life.

critical_analysis.relevance: ONAOS - A Guide to the Sinister Tarot is highly relevant within the study of Western Esotericism and Occultism as a foundational text for understanding the specific magical system and cosmology of the Order of Nine Angles (ONA). It explicitly critiques traditional Qabalistic and Golden Dawn interpretations of Tarot, presenting an alternative, non-qabalistic septenary framework centered on 'acausal energies' and 'Dark Gods.' This positions it as a significant counter-tradition within modern esotericism, offering a unique perspective on magical initiation, pathworking, and the nature of consciousness and reality. The detailed explanations of ritual mechanics, symbolic correspondences, and psychological stages (Unconscious, Ego, Self) make it a crucial primary source for academics and practitioners interested in extreme or Left Hand Path occultism and the development of Aeonic magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is individuals engaged with or aspiring to join the Order of Nine Angles, or those deeply immersed in Left Hand Path (LHP) and Sinister traditions of magic. This includes initiates seeking practical guidance for self-transformation, pathworking, and interaction with specific non-human entities (Dark Gods). Given its technical language, explicit rejection of mainstream occult paradigms, and focus on personal, direct experience over dogmatic interpretations, it also appeals to advanced occult practitioners and academic researchers specializing in esoteric studies who wish to understand the theoretical and practical underpinnings of the ONA's unique system. The text is not suitable for beginners in occultism due to its specialized terminology and advanced concepts.
